page.title: 15FARMING IN 1985
page.content:
around August or September, it is chopped down by a Combine Harvester (which is a large machine that has a large barrel of spikes which rotate at the front). This is driven up the fields and it separates the grain from the stalks (straw). The grain is then bagged and the straw is baled and used as bedding for the cows and calves in the winter. The farmers of Europe have joined an organisation called the EEC (common market), here many countries of Europe have joined together, and exchange goods between themselves. Unfortuantly there is too much surplus product and the EEC has made each country cut down on quantity. This has affected many small farmers.
by Robert Hitchen & Phillip Leighton
